description: From Latin manumittere, from pre-Classical Latin manu emittere, literally ‘send out from one’s hand’.

verbs.description: manumit (third-person singular simple present manumits, present participle manumitting, simple past and past participle manumitted)

entries.meaning: To release from slavery, to free.
examples: Ruth wept much but Sara set her beauty to a fierce grimness which, even when, as you shall hear later, she was manumitted, she never entirely lost.
